island: ^Duckman: Hey there fellow humanoid! What brings you to these lands?
^Robot: Just passing through, looking at the scenery.
^Duckman: Then you might want to check out a pretty island over there. It has a lovely forest on it.

c-1: ^Well if you reconsider, just say the word.

island_retry: ^Duckman: Did you reconsider? Just say the word, and I'll tell you how to get over there.
island_accept: ^Duckman: Great. Just head over to the brodge.
^There should be a button near it you can press to extend it.
^It's a bit stuck so you really have to jam it in to activate it.
island_follow_up: ^Duckman: Did you already checkout the island?
^Just head over to the bridge and press the button.
island_apples: ^Robot: Yes, I even found some appples in the forest!
island_done: ^Duckman: It is a nice island, isn't it?

stuck: ^Robot: The button seems to be stuck.
extend: ^The mechanism inside the bridge starts to rumble an the deck starts to slowly move until the bridge is fully extend.
retract: ^Just as the bridge extended, it retracts with a rumble.

apples_start: ^Duck: Hey, can you do me a favour?
^Duck: Can you pick me up some <color#AA0000>apples</color> in the forest?
apples_running: ^Robot: Not yet. but I'm working on it.
apples_delivering: ^Robot: Here are your <color#AA0000>apples</color>. Freshly gathered from the forest.

intro_start: ^Librarian: I'm the school librarian and I'll help you to get through your first day of school.
^Librarian: Since this is your first day here, you have to get to know our houses.
^Librarian: There are four different elements Fire, Water, Air and Earth. Each element represents a different specialization.
^Librarian: So your task for today is to decide in which house you want to go. Therefore you have to do different tasks from each house.
^Librarian: At first go to the Air Teacher right behind the open gate. He will give you the first task.
intro_running: ^Librarian: Please go to the Air Teacher.
gate_start: ^Tammy: I'm done with my task from the Air Teacher..
^Librarian: Next you have to go through the big gate... But the handle is lost. Maybe you can find it? Go search near the Telescope because I couldn't find it here.
gate_running: ^Librarian: It has to be somewhere near the Telescope.
gate_delivering: ^Librarian: Great! Use it to open the gate.
^Librarian: Oh! And one more thing. Go to the Fire Teacher next. He will have the next task for you.
gate_finished: ^Librarian: Please go to the Fireteacher next.

closed: ^You: Hm.. something seems to be is missing...
open: ^You: I can go to the next area!

welcome: ^Dennis: Hey! Welcome! You must be new.
^Dennis: If you have any questions go to the Librarian.
running: ^Dennis: Have fun on your first day.

airteacher_welcome: ^Air teacher: Hey! You must be new! Welcome to our Academy.
^Air teacher: Please go to the Librarian if you have any questions.
air_quest_start: ^Air teacher: Hello and welcome to our Academy.
^Tammy: The Librarian told me you've a task for me!
^Air teacher: At frist I'll tell you something about out element Air.
^Air teacher: We describe ourselfs as very social and openminded. We deal with astronomy and the celestial bodies.
^Air teacher: So you first task for today, go ahead and look through the Teleskop and count the constellations.
^Air teacher: After your done with it come back to me and tell me how many you counted.
air_quest_pending: ^Air teacher: Please use the Telescope to count the constellations.

c-1: ^Air teacher: Take as many time you need.

air_quest_delivering: ^Air teacher: Great! So how many constellations did you count?

c-1: ^Air teacher: Are you sure? Maybe take another look.

air_quest_done: ^Air teacher: Good job! Now you have a little taste of the things we do.
^Air teacher: I don't have any tasks for you left. Go back to the Librarian and ask her what you can do next.
^Tammy: That was great! I'm so excided about the next tasks. Thank you so much!
air_quest_final: ^Air teacher: I don't have any tasks left. Please go back to the Librarian. Good luck!

dont_touch: ^Tammy: I'm sure that I'm not allowed to touch this.

welcome: ^Sören: Hello there, I didnt see you before so you must be new?
^Tammy: uhm... Yes I don't know my way around here, can you help me?
^Sören: Sure sure, at first you have to talk with the librarian next to the library if you havent done yet.
^Sören: Anyway did you hear from the cosmic cyclone near the Sateklon Sphere?
^Tammy: No... But thanks for your help, See you.
running: ^Sören: ... the cyclone takes a way to unity ...
^Sören: Is there a problem? Let me know!

dialog_1: ^Yves: Do you have the Runelore homework done?
^Pascal: No.. I didn't understand a thing from the stuff he told us.
^Pascal: The explanations were so long.. that at some point I couldn't pay attention anymore.
^Yves: The circumference of the runic circle is equivalent to the magnitude of the flowthrough of arcane energy,
^Yves: which is inverse proportional to the difference between the spells primary element and its opposite reactor.
dialog_2: ^Yves: I have so many things to do..

dialog_1: ^Yves: Do you have the Runelore homework done?
^Pascal: No.. I didn't understand a thing from the stuff he told us.
^Pascal: The explanations were so long.. that at some point I couldn't pay attention anymore.
^Yves: The circumference of the runic circle is equivalent to the magnitude of the flowthrough of arcane energy,
^Yves: which is inverse proportional to the difference between the spells primary element and its opposite reactor.
dialog_2: ^Pascal: If the circumference of the circle is equivalent.. then the arcane energe..
^Pascal: I think I'll go to the library later...
dialog_3: ^Pascal: Did you know if you mix some Balsamweed, Kaduzuleaves and Magnapetals, you'll get an AMAZING potion?
^Yves: And what effect does it have?
^Pascal: I used it in the last Runelore lesson for concentration. I can literally remember everything!!
^Yves: So maybe YOU can help me now!
^Tammy: I don't understand any of these words...

waterquest_start: ^Water Teacher: You are the new one right?
^Water Teacher: You look so adoreable in your cute little skirt.
^Water Teacher: So you're done with Air and Fire right?
^Water Teacher: Great! I'll teach you something about the Element Water.
^Water Teacher: We brew all kinds potions.
^Water Teacher: But for our potions we need ingridients.
^Water Teacher: Therefor we work close togeher with the Earth Element. Since without their ingredients we wouldn't be able to make our Potions.
^Water Teacher: You will brew your own potion today.
^Water Teacher: It'll be a just a simple healing Potion that can heal small wounds or scratches.
^Water Teacher: I have almost all ingridients here. Only one is left.
^Water Teacher: It's a pink tree lechee.
^Water Teacher: Go to the Earth Teacher and ask if you can pick one from their garden.
^Tammy: Sure! I'll get it for you.
waterquest_pending: ^Water Teacher: Do you have the pink tree lechee?
waterquest_running: ^Tammy: I have the pink tree lechee!
^Water Teacher: Great! Here are the other ingridients.
^Water Teacher: A sour sprout, sweet blue lemon and your pink tree lechee.
^Water Teacher: Put everything in the couldron and wait a little bit until it's done.
^Water Teacher: It's a magical couldron so it will tell you when your potion is done.
^Water Teacher: Just ask it sometimes.. it's forgetful.
^Tammy: I've never seen a speaking cauldron before.
waterquest_progress: ^Water Teacher: Remember to ask the cauldron a few times if it's ready.
waterquest_delivering: ^Water Teacher: It's amazing! You did a great job for your first time!
^Water Teacher: Well there is only one teacher left. It's the Earth teacher.
^Water Teacher: Please go there for your last task.
waterquest_done: ^Water Teacher: You did amazing! Have a nice day.

earthquest_start: ^Tammy: Hello I'm sorry, I'm Tammy and ...
^Earth Teacher: Uh hello there! I didn't recognize you. Sorry.
^Earth Teacher: How can I help you?
^Tammy: Yes! Hi! I'm new here and the Water Teacher told me that you have a task for me.
^Earth Teacher: Hmm.. do I? I know.. that something

firequest_start: ^Fire Teacher: Hello there. The Librarian sent you here right?!
^Tammy: Yes! I'm here for my next task!
^Fire teacher: Well. Don't expect me to be one of the nice sounding teachers like the others.
^Fire Teacher: If you follow my rules, everything will go smoothlie.
^Fire Teacher: Not "WHAT"! It means "Sir"! Got it?
^Fire Teacher: So.. Briefly about the element Fire.
^Fire Teacher: It's hot, aggressive and dangerous. These are the main things you should know about it.
^Fire Teacher: If you're not carefull with it, you'll end up like me.
^Fire Teacher: Now listen, for your task you'll learn how to use it.
^Fire Teacher: You need to focus, concentrate on you breathing and think about your target and where you want to hit it.
^Fire Teacher: Then go to the marks on the floor and try it out.
^Fire Teacher: Try to hit the Target right in the middle.
^Tammy: I'm way to scared to say something else..
firequest_running: ^Fire Teacher: What's the problem? Forgot what I told you?
^Fire Teacher: What is so hard to understand?
firequest_delivering: ^Fire Teacher: I don't say it that often.. but you did a great job!
^Fire Teacher: I'm done with you for today.
^Fire Teacher: Go to your next task. Talk to the Water Teacher next to the big cauldron.
^Tammy: Finally I can go somewhere else...
firequest_finished: ^Fire Teacher: You're done here. Go make your next task!

confused: ^Tammy: I'm not sure what to do here.
^Tammy: I'm not sure what to do here.
^Tammy: I'm not sure what to do here.
